intro: Collinsia diehlii, commonly known as the San Diego mountain jewelflower, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. It is a perennial herb that thrives in open, sunny areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
